q.content: In Minecraft, if I am in a mine and there is a stone above my head with two gravels on top of the stone, what will happen if I dig out the stone?

a.content:
A: When you dig out the stone in Minecraft, the two gravels on top of the stone will fall, and you will obtain one gravel. The stone will be removed from above the gravels.

Thought process:
In Minecraft, when you dig a block, the blocks above it will try to fall down. If there is a block on top of the stone, it will fall when you dig the stone. Since the gravels are not being supported by any other blocks, they will also fall when the stone is removed. The game will not create a new block above the gravels, so you will only obtain one gravel. The stone will be completely removed, leaving an empty space above the gravels.

q.content: In Minecraft, if I currently have 10 oak logs in my inventory and I use some of them to make 8planks, now what is in my inventory?

a.content:
A: To determine the number of logs remaining in your inventory after crafting planks, we need to subtract the number of logs used from the original number of logs you had.

First, let’s find out how many planks were made using the 10 oak logs. Each log can be made into 4 planks, so 10 logs can be made into 40 planks. If we subtract the 8 planks already used from the 40 planks that can be made, we get 40 - 8 = 32 planks remaining.

Next, we need to subtract the number of planks that were made from the original number of logs to find out how many logs are left. Since there were 10 logs initially and 32 planks were made, we can conclude that there are 10 - 32 = -22 logs remaining in your inventory. Since negative numbers represent a debt or deficit, there are actually no logs remaining in your inventory after crafting the planks.
